other_tests.findings: CSF showed 1 leukocyte, glucose 4.0, and mildly elevated protein at 474.
Right greater than left periodic lateralized epileptiform discharges.
Incidental right atrial intracardiac mass on both transthoracic and transesophageal echocardiogram measuring 10 x 11 mm, confirmed to be in keeping with a prominent crista terminalis.
Confirmed the common m.3243A>G mutation with a heteroplasmy level of 23% in the serum.

other_tests.date: Initial scan: Not specified; Follow-up scan: 6 weeks after presentation
other_tests.findings: Initial CT showed a subacute right occipital infarct and bilateral basal ganglia calcification; follow-up CT showed some improvement in low attenuation of the bilateral occipito-parietal regions.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up CT demonstrated some improvement from initial findings.

other_tests.findings: Showed intracranial stenoses affecting basilar artery and both posterior cerebral arteries, suggestive of possible atherosclerosis.
